model.hand.analyzer

Class HandAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.hand.analyzer.HandAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HandAnalyzerInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HoldEmAnalyzer, OmahaAnalyzer, SimpleAnalyzer

    public abstract class HandAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
implements HandAnalyzerInterface
    Abstract representation of a HandAnalyzer object, used to analyze hands to find the hand with the best possible HandRank.

    The HandAnalyzer is represented by the Hand's best rank, the best five card hand, the ranks of any pairs, the full hand, and the ranks of the full house if the hand contains one.

    Since:
    9/26/16
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Emmet Murray

      • HandAnalyzer

        public HandAnalyzer(java.util.List<Card> fullHand)

        The constructor constructs a new HandAnalyzer, but the analyze method must be called on it before any data can be accessed from this.

        Parameters:
        fullHand - the fullHand to analyze using the object

      • findPairRanks

        protected final void findPairRanks()
        Used to correctly initialize pairRanks for a Simple Analyzer implementation.

        Code was included in the abstract class to allow it access to private instance variables.

        Requires:
        this is a SimpleAnalyzer
        Ensures:
        |return| = 2 -> {high rank, low rank}

      • findFullHouseRanks

        protected final void findFullHouseRanks()
        Used to correctly initialize fullHouseRanks for a Simple Analyzer implementation.

        Code was included in the abstract class to allow it access to private instance variables.

        Requires:
        this is a SimpleAnalyzer
        Ensures:
        |return| = 2 -> {3Kind rank, Pair rank}

        Analyzes a five card hand to determine its best HandRank.
        Parameters:
        hand - the hand to analyze
        Returns:
        the best HandRank that can describe hand

      • handToEnumMaps

        protected final void handToEnumMaps(java.util.List<Card> hand,
                                    java.util.EnumMap<Card.Rank,java.lang.Integer> rankMap,
                                    java.util.EnumMap<Card.Suit,java.lang.Integer> suitMap)
        Creates two enumMaps used to store rank and suit by number of occurrences, respectively.
        Parameters:
        hand - the hand to break down into maps
        rankMap - the map to store Ranks as keys and their number of occurrences as their values
        suitMap - the map to store Suits as keys and their number of occurrences as their values
